questions.question: How many dimensions does an unit cell of a n dimensional lattice have?

explanations.c: It is necessary that the unit cell has the same number of dimensions as the lattice

questions.question: Which of these are non primitive unit cells?

explanations.c: The above two unit cells have more than one atom in them and hence are non primitive unit cells.

questions.question: How many atoms are a part of a BCC unit cell disregarding the contribution factor from atoms?

explanations.c: Disregarding contributions, BCC has 8 atoms at vertices and one inside its body at the center.

questions.question: How many atoms are a part of a FCC unit cell disregarding the contribution factor from atoms?

explanations.a: Disregarding contributions, FCC has 8 atoms at vertices and 6 atoms at faces of the cube.

questions.question: Considering contributions of atoms to other unit cells, what are the number of atoms in a FCC unit cell?

explanations.b: The 8 vertice atoms contribute as one atom and the 6 face atoms contribute as 3 atoms to the unit cell, totalling to 4 atoms in the unit cell

questions.question: Considering contributions of atoms to other unit cells, what are the number of atoms in a HCP unit cell?

explanations.d: The 12 vertice atoms contribute as 2 atoms, the 2 face centered atoms contribute as 1 and the 3 internal atoms contribute as 3 atoms. This totals to 6 atoms inside the HCP unit cell.
